TopicTitle: You come out of warp drive and find yourself in the KSP solar system

Articles.Content:
What would you do?

I would secretly populate the airfield a few kilos out of the runway.

Well seeing as I have a spaceship capable of warp speed, and all the techno wizardry coming with it

I'd probably plant a flag on the newly discovered land and claim it for the king. O wait, I'm not British
That's ok Sirrobert, we don't have a king ^^. Elizabeth II Regina Est
I'd go colonize laythe, then duna, then start an all-out invasion on kerbin. Chances are i'd lose to Jebediah, but it would be fun nonetheless.
I'd thank the kerbals again for the warp drive. Kerbalkind is the only species that allocates sufficient funds to their space program to build one, after all, so it's likely that they gave it to me.

I would descend to Kerbin, establish friendly human-kerbal relations, share my technology and knowledge with the kerbals, and return to Earth with my findings and achievements.

-Duxwing
I would leave before Jeb discovered that I had a warp drive
sadly the warp field disrupted space time, causing the sun to go nova. Oops.
I would add moar boosters. This is not the solar system I were looking for.

I'd stay off the recreational beverages for a few days, since all I can see on my scopes are little green men that seem to blow up a lot at random. lol

Greets,

Jan
i found out that finding the kerbol system don't solve any of the question that sent me there in the first place. Wich is an answer in itself

"You come out of warp drive and find yourself in the KSP solar system" and I would ask my helmsman why did we stop in an uninteresting system. Plot a new course to a more interesting star system and warp again.

I. Beam! Down... TO THE! Planet. And make! Friendly... relations. With the! Kerbals!

Shatner! Style! Narration! For the... WIN!
Boring realistic answer: try and figure out why the celestials are so dense.

I'd bookmark it and then look for another cool star system out there in the vast unexplored procedural world of Space Engine. Maybe one with TWO inhabited planets so I can watch them fight make contact and establish peaceable relations for the advancement of Science... or fight.
I have warp drive. I leave
Place a secret stealth camera on each planet and enjoy watching kerbals blow stuff up.
Yell loudly because we warped about 3 kilometers from the magic distance in which everything goes poof.
